for_sales.sales_text:
"Christiane of Mersea" is a traditional Falmouth sailing boat, a "Heard 28". The hull was fitted out in wood to a high standard of workmanship and commissioned in the UK for sailing in May 1998.

Hugh and his wife Runi sailed "Christiane of Mersea" on the East and South coasts of the UK until July 2005 when they departed with two crew members and sailed from Falmouth to Croatia. Her home port became the Marina of Punat, Island of Krk. She was registerd in Croatia PN1513 in 2013 and sold to Marko Lastro in 2014 who passed away in 2016.

The sale price has been reduced due to damage to the engine and steering over the winter.

boat.full_description:
Hugh Phillips purchased a new fibreglass hull from Gaffers and Luggers in 1997. 'Christiane of Mersea' is a traditional Falmouth sailing boat, a 'Heard 28'.

The hull was fitted out in wood to a high standard of workmanship and commissioned in the UK for sailing in May 1998.

Hugh and his wife Runi sailed 'Christiane of Mersea' on the East and South coasts of the UK until July 2005 when they departed with two crew members and sailed from Falmouth to Croatia. Her home port became the Marina of Punat, Island of Krk. She was registerd in Croatia PN1513 in 2013 and sold to Marko Lastro in 2014 who passed away in 2016.

In 2017, she was sold to a new owner in Mayfield, UK.
boat.name: Christiane of Mersea
boat.short_description: Sailed from Falmouth by her original owners to her current home port in Croatia, 2005.
